summary: ARDS is a common and severe lung disease that is associated with high rates of mortality and morbidity. the characteristic features of ARDS include excessively uncontrolled inflammation, hypoxemia and non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema formation. the main sites of cell injury in ARDS are the vascular endothelium and alveolar epithelium (4). NF-B is a critical nuclear transcription factor, able to activate the transcription of a number of inflammatory cytokine genes and regulate the inflammatory response and immunoreaction (12). Typically, NF-B exists as an inactive dimer in the cytoplasm and directly combines with an inhibitor of nuclear-factor B (IB) to produce a trimeric complex. CINC and ENA-78 regulate NF-B phosphorylation and inhibit NF-B activation. mice were allowed free access to water and standard laboratory chow. PDTC was administered 30 min prior the injection of LPS. the mice were anesthetized by intraperitoneal injection with 10% chloral hydrate (3.5 ml/kg; Sigma-Aldrich), prior to sacrifice via aortic phlebotomy at the indicated time points. the left lung was prepared for hematoxylin and eosin staining (Beyotime Institute of Biotechnology) and immunohistochemistry, while the right lung was prepared for western blot analysis. inflammatory cell infiltration, hemorrhage, interstitial and alveolar edema and thickness of the alveolar septum in five random fields in a blind manner using a light microscope. the difference between alveolar and arterial oxygen partial pressure was analyzed in 150-l arterial blood samples. the oxygen partial pressure was calculated according to the results of a blood gas analysis. the samples were placed on ice for 30 min before centrifugation at 4°C and 12,000 g for 2 min in order to produce the aspirate supernatant (nucleoprotein) the membrane was washed three times for 5 min each with 1X TBS containing 0.15 Tween-20. the membrane was then incubated for 1 h with horseradish peroxidase-conjugated secondary antibodies (1:1,000; Beyotime Institute of Biotechnology) sections of lung tissue (4 m) were incubated with primary antibodies anti-NF-B (1:300; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.), anti-CINC (1:300; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.) and anti-ENA-78 (1:200; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.) mice received an intraperitoneal injection of 20 mg/kg LPS (escherichia coli O55:B5; Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA) and an i.p. injection of PDTC. mice were anesthetized by intraperitoneal injection with 10% chloral hydrate. the left lung was prepared for hematoxylin and eosin (HE) staining (Beyotime Institute of Biotechnology) and immunohistochemistry, while the right lung was prepared for western blot analysis. the left lung was fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde (San Diego, CA, USA) the oxygen partial pressure (alveolar oxygen partial pressure) was calculated according to the results of a blood gas analysis: PaO2 = (atmospheric pressure 47) FiO2 - PaCO2 / R - arterial blood oxygen partial pressure. the linear correlation coefficient was calculated to study the efficacy of gas exchange. the total protein quantity was analyzed using a Pierce BCA Protein Assay kit (#23250; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.) and anti-ENA-78 (1:200; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.) overnight at 4°C and then with polyclonal immunoglobulins/HRP (1:100; Beyotime Institute of Biotechnology) for 1 h at room temperature. oral cyanosis and blood-like liquid in the nose were observed. in the PDTC + LPS group, the lung volume was increased. the shortness of breath was attenuated and the lung was less inflamed and reddened. in the PDTC + LPS group, the lung volume was increased. effect of PDTC on P(A-a)O2 in ARDS mice was significantly higher in the LPS group in comparison with the control group at each time point. however, P(A-a)O2 in the PDTC + LPS group was significantly higher compared with the control group at each time point. expression levels of p-NF-B protein expression in the cytoplasm and nucleus in lung tissue were significantly higher in the PDTC + LPS group. but p-NF-B protein expression in the lung tissue of the PDTC + LPS group was significantly reduced, as compared with the control group (P0.05) this suggests that PDTC can effectively inhibit the phosphorylation of NF-B (Fig. 4A and B). expression levels of NF-B, CINC and ENA-78 were markedly increased in the lung tissue of LPS-induced ARDS mice. expression levels of NF-B, CINC and ENA-78 were markedly increased in the lung tissue of LPS-induced ARDS mice. cells in the LPS lung tissue were infiltrated PMNs and endothelial cells. expression of NF-B, CINC and ENA-78 was not detected in mice. expression of nuclear factor (NF)-B in lung tissue determined by immunohistochemistry. expression levels of IL-8 and IL-10 in serum and BALF decreased. expression levels of IL-8 and IL-10 decreased in comparison with control group. PDTC + LPS group increased expression level of IL-10 in serum and BALF. PDTC + LPS was significantly higher in the LPS and PDTC + LPS groups. but the proportion of PMNs was significantly reduced in the PDTC + LPS group in comparison with the LPS group. pathology of lung tissue determined by HE staining In the control group, the structure of the lung tissue was normal. however, in the LPS group after 12 and 24 h, the alveoli septum was thickened, the pulmonary interstitial was highly congested and the alveolar wall was fractured. as time progressed there was an increase in inflammatory cell infiltration and aggravated lung tissue damage. PDTC, the level of oxygenation improved in lung tissue as time progressed. but the P(A-a)O2 gradually decreased in comparison with the control group. p-NF-B protein expression in the cytoplasm and nucleus in lung tissue was significantly reduced, as compared with the control group. the expression of p-NF-B and NF-B P65 protein expression was significantly increased in the cytoplasm of the PDTC + LPS group. expression of p-NF-B was significantly increased in the cytoplasm of the LPS group (P0.01) and significantly decreased in the PDTC + LPS group (P0.05) CINC expression was detected by qPCR. mRNA expression of CINC was detected by RT-PCR. expression levels of NF-B, CINC and ENA-78 were markedly increased. no ENA-78 positive cells were detected in the NS group. expression levels of IL-8 and IL-10 in the serum and BALF from the LPS group were significantly increased. expression level of IL-10 in the serum and BALF from the LPS group was significantly decreased. expression of IL-8 in (A) serum and (B) BALF. expression of IL-10 in (C) serum and (D) BALF. number of leukocytes was significantly increased in the LPS group. ARDS mice were breathing easily and their lungs appeared pink upon dissection. shortness of breath with oral cyanosis and blood-like liquid in the nose was observed. the lung volume was increased, the lungs were deep purple in appearance and flake bleeding was observed. ocarbamate (PDTC) on lung histopathological changes of mice at 12 and 24 h following intraperitoneal injection with saline, and lipopolysaccharide (LPS) with or without PDTC. effect of PDTC on P(A-a)O2 in LPS-induced ARDS mice P(A-a)O2 was significantly higher in the LPS group in comparison with the control group at each time point. expression levels of p-NF-B and NF-B P65 protein expression in the cytoplasm and nucleus in lung tissue were significantly higher in the PDTC + LPS group. however, p-NF-B protein expression in the lung tissue of the PDTC + LPS group was significantly reduced, as compared with the control group. the production of P65 was significantly increased in the cytoplasm (P0.05) and significantly decreased in the nucleus, of the PDTC + LPS group. expression of CINC mRNA in lung tissue was significantly increased in the mice that received an i.p. injection of LPS in comparison with the control group (P0.01) CINC and ENA-78 were markedly increased in the lung tissue of ARDS mice. majority of cells in the LPS lung tissue were infiltrated PMNs and endothelial cells. expression of NF-B, CINC and ENA-78 was not detected in the lung tissue. no positive cells were detected in the NS group. expression levels of IL-8 and IL-10 in serum and BALF decreased. expression levels of IL-8 and IL-10 in serum and BALF decreased. the proportion of PMNs in BALF was significantly higher in the LPS and PDTC + LPS groups. but the proportion of PMNs was significantly reduced in the PDTC + LPS group. NF-B is a target for anti-inflammatory ARDS treatment. NF-B is a central transcription factor that promotes the production of cytokines, adhesion molecules and chemokines by specifically binding to B promoters in the nucleus. previous studies have shown that when NF-B is excessively activated, IL-8 and TNF- are overexpressed, whereas IL-10 is decreased, in ARDS (20). in patients with ARDS, the body can prevent excessive activation of the inflammatory response by activating an anti-inflammatory response and releasing anti-inflammatory cytokines. IL-10 is a crucial anti-inflammatory cytokine in the immune response and can inhibit the production of IL-8 and TNF- in monocytes and macrophages. overexpression can aggravate the immune response (17,32) CINC mRNA and protein inhibits PMN apoptosis and activates a large number of PMNs, causing them to accumulate in the lung and result in lung injury (11). endogenous TNF- is associated with the increased expression of ENA-78. the NF-B signaling pathway may become an important target in regulating ARDS in the lung. this suggests that the NF-B signaling pathway may become an important target in regulating ARDS in the lung. this suggests that it may be useful in investigating the pathogenesis of ARDS.
